abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the Tehran
            Drainage Project is rated as satisfactory, particularly with
            regards to the physical components. The first objective to
            provide storm water drainage to divert flood waters away
            from flood-prone areas was achieved. The second objective to
            transfer appropriate technology for the construction of
            tunnels has also been achieved with the second tunnel
            constructed using a tunnel boring machine. The third
            objective to strengthen the institutional capacity of the
            Tehran Municipality through technical assistance for project
            planning and implementation and for sound municipal finance
            management was partly achieved. The main lessons drawn from
            the project is that institutional improvements are more
            difficult to achieve than physical components. They require
            careful diagnosis of the bottlenecks and a good
            understanding of the institutions involved. Furthermore,
            agreed upon measures for change should be reasonable and
            consistent with the institutional capacity of client
            organizations. Their implementation and expected results
            take longer than the time horizon of a single project.
